headline: Kamala Harris slammed over report she refused to appear in student debt video with Biden: Team player
author: Hanna Panreck
sentences: "The vice president has been increasingly wary of becoming part of the public face of the administrations response," Playbook said, noting that the progressive wing of the Democrat Party has been calling for more aggressive forgiveness of student loans.

A group of GOP senators pushed legislation in April that would prevent Biden from canceling student loan debt and limit the president's ability to halt or extend student loan payments, which Biden recently extended until the end of August.

Critics slammed Vice President Kamala Harris after Politico's "West Wing Playbook" revealed the vice president reportedly opted to not appear with President Joe Biden in a video about student debt forgiveness.
Scott Jennings, a conservative commentator, responded to the report on Twitter, and asked "Is there a Democrat in the country who will appear with Joe Biden?"
The report said that the "delicate politics" represent a larger disagreement over loan forgiveness among members in the Biden administration.
The only way it would be truly fair is if universities themselves had to fund it, alongside reforms to the system," Pushaw said on Twitter.
American Commitment president Philip Kerpen joked, saying, "She thinks she has a long-term," along with multiple crying laughing emojis.
"My talks with him and his staff have been very fruitful over the last little while and I am hopeful that he will do the right thing.
Biden shut down the progressive proposal to cancel $50,000 in student loan debt for borrowers via executive action in February 2021.
Ron DeSantis, R-Fla., reacted to the report as well and argued that student loan forgiveness was not a progressive policy.
"Student debt cancellation isnt really a progressive policy at all if working class Americans are expected to fund it.
Sen. Chuck Schumer, D-NY, said in late April that Biden was getting close to forgiving up to $50,000 in student debt.
"The more debt that is forgiven, the more the policy is REGRESSIVE, not PROGRESSIVE," she said.
And I say to my colleagues, I think the president is moving in our direction," Schumer said.
Rachael Larimore, the managing editor at The Dispatch, also responded to the report.
The Washington Free Beacon's Chuck Ross tweeted "Amazing" in response to the report.
"Ill keep urging the president to take this important step.
"Curious what she thinks her next step in politics is.
Its another massive upward wealth transfer.
Christina Pushaw, press secretary for Gov.
Dont think POTUS is in her future.
"Team player," he continued.
Maybe San Fran mayor."
Were getting closer."
